medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute upper respiratory tract infection with sore throat, cough, and subjective fevers and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to the visit, including sore throat, cough productive of green sputum, and subjective fever/chills. Symptoms progressed with mild shortness of breath but without pleuritic chest pain. The patient self-treated with fluids and acetaminophen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypothyroidism, iritis (6 episodes, positive for HLA-B27 antigen), and arthritis.
medical_history.family_history: Father with distant history of tuberculosis, sister with uterine cancer, a son who had an angioplasty at age 32, one brother with ankylosing spondylitis.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, drinks alcohol in moderation, and exercises with a personal trainer several times weekly. Works in family business, lives with husband, and has three grown children.
